headline: Pope Asks Europe to Do More for Migrants
summary: Pope Francis joined Italy in pressing the European Union to do more to help the country cope with rapidly mounting numbers of people rescued in the Mediterranean.

headline: ECB’s Draghi Rejects Talk of Greek Exit
summary: European Central Bank chief Mario Draghi rejected talk that Greece might be forced to leave the euro, reiterating that the eurozone currency is irrevocable.

headline: Republicans Hammer at Obama in New Hampshire
summary: Nearly 20 Republican presidential hopefuls attacked President Barack Obama more than Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton on the closing day of a New Hampshire party conference Saturday.

headline: Cyprus Passes Insolvency Laws Sought by Creditors
summary: Cyprus passed insolvency laws with foreclosure rules sought by creditors as a condition for extending more loans to the country.

headline: BMW Recalls 91,800 Minis for Air-Bag Fix
summary: German auto maker BMW says it is recalling 91,800 Mini Coopers to fix a defect that may prevent the air bag on the front passenger side of the cars from deploying in a crash.

headline: Ford Unveils New Taurus for China
summary: Ford Motor unveiled a new Taurus sedan aimed at affluent Chinese customers, in an effort to stand out in a slowing and increasingly competitive market.

headline: Israel, Palestinians Agree on Tax Funds
summary: Palestinian Authority president Mahmoud Abbas said he has reached an agreement with Israel in which tax revenue it collects for the Palestinians will be transferred after a four-month freeze.

headline: Violence in South Africa Spreads
summary: Mobs in South Africa attacked shops owned by immigrants in a poor area of Johannesburg following similar violence in another part of the country.

headline: Man Shot, Killed by Chicago Police Officer
summary: Chicago police have shot and killed a man in the city’s South Shore neighborhood after officers said he pointed a gun at them.

headline: ISIS Allies Claim Deadly Afghan Blast
summary: Militants allied with Islamic State said they were behind a suicide bombing near a bank in Jalalabad that killed at least 33 people.

headline: Iran Warns Saudi Arabia on Yemen Airstrikes
summary: Iranian President Hasan Rouhani harshly criticized Saudi Arabia, warning the country will harvest the hatred it is sowing in Yemen through its airstrike campaign.

headline: A Downward Dog Eat Downward Dog World
summary: Some yoga and other fitness classes have grown so popular that fans are going to frantic lengths as they jockey for a space to de-stress.

headline: Australia Arrests Five Teens in Terror Plot
summary: Five Australian teenagers were arrested Saturday on suspicion of plotting a terrorist attack that included targeting police officers, officials said.

headline: Shopping Mall Developer Taubman Dies
summary: A. Alfred Taubman, the self-made billionaire who cemented the enclosed shopping mall into American culture has died. He was 91.

headline: Indiana Reports More HIV Cases
summary: An Indiana county at the heart of an HIV outbreak has seen a “significant increase” in the number of cases more than two weeks into a short-term needle exchange program.

headline: GOP Hopefuls Focus Ire at Obama
summary: With 18 announced and likely Republican presidential candidates in New Hampshire this weekend for a forum, the focus has been more on Barack Obama than on Hillary Clinton.
